value.title: Introduction to Power BI Embedded | Power BI Embedded Step by Step Series | Part 1
value.excerpt: Welcome to Power BI Embedded Step by Step series. Myself Dhruvin Shah. The entire series is dedicated to the Intermediate level of Power BI folks. The series covers step by step guide to embed the Power BI report in any third-party custom application or SaaS application. During this video, we will learn
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Or0oYJO7s7Q" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Maintain Tab Order for Power BI Report
value.excerpt: During this session, we will talk about how we can maintain Tab Order for Power BI Report. From a report accessibility standpoint, it is necessary to maintain tab order for our Power BI Report. Sometimes when end users are accessing the Power BI Report, they are using keyboard key “Tab” to move between
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/DMce0qKA_Kg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Make a Table Visualization to Display All Observations from Data Source in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this session, I’m demonstrating how we can show all the records even if it is the same as the Power BI table. We all know that the Power BI table visual automatically removes the duplicate rows from end-users in the table. But sometimes we need to show the end-users all the values from the data source

value.title: New Format Pane for Power BI Mobile View

value.title: Power BI Tip - Hide Filter Pane From the Published Version of Power BI Report
value.excerpt: In this vlog we will learn about how we can hide the Filter Pane from the published version of the Power BI report. Sometimes there are situations in which we have set our Visual, Page or Report level filter as a part of development logic and we wish that end user should not able to change those values.

value.title: Quickly create Power BI Report from SharePoint List  or Microsoft List
value.excerpt: We will learn how to quickly create our Power BI Report directly from SharePoint List or Microsoft Lists during this session. This is the first integration experience with Power BI. This experience empowers SharePoint list and Microsoft List users to easily explore their list data with just a few clicks.

value.title: Relative Time Slicer in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this session, we will discuss the new feature rolled out during the April 2020 Update of Power BI Desktop.  Now, we can add  Time Slicer with the OOTB date filter in Power BI.   With Relative Time Slicer, we can filter data based on the time.  Sometimes there are situations, where we need to filter

value.title: Azure Active Directory and Power BI
value.excerpt: I take a look at how Power BI and Azure Active Directory interact.  Really it is more about Azure Active Directory and how do you get users into AAD.  This came up as I get pinged a lot from folks wondering how they can use AAD with Power BI, not necessarily realizing that it is already there.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/09/15/azure-active-directory-and-power-bi.aspx

value.title: Best kept SECRET in Power BI??? You tell us!
value.excerpt: Have we found the best kept SECRET in Power BI? Adam saw this recently and was BLOWN away! Zooming in can help with presenting in business settings and anywhere else. Here are a few things you can use to make that presentation better with Power BI.  ZoomIt:  https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/zoomit
